verses.text: \add My\add* son, hast thou sinned? do so no more, But ask pardon for thy former \add sins\add*.
Flee from sin as from the face of a serpent: For if thou comest \add too\add* near it, it will bite thee: The teeth thereof \add are\add* as the teeth of a lion, Slaying the souls of men.
All iniquity \add is\add* as a twoedged sword, The wounds whereof cannot \add be\add* healed.
To terrify and do wrong will waste riches: Thus the house of proud \add men\add* shall be made desolate.
A prayer out of a poor \add man\add*’s mouth \add reacheth\add* to the ears \add of God\add*, And his judgment cometh speedily.
He that hateth to be reproved \add is\add* in the way of sinners: But he that feareth the Lord will repent from his heart.
An eloquent man \add is\add* known far and near; But a man of understanding knoweth when he slippeth.
He that buildeth his house with other men’s money \add Is\add* like one that gathereth himself stones for the tomb of his burial.
The congregation of the wicked \add is like\add* tow wrapped together: And the end of them \add is\add* a flame of fire to destroy \add them\add*.
The way of sinners \add is\add* made plain with stones, But at the end thereof \add is\add* the pit of hell.
He that keepeth the law of the Lord getteth the understanding thereof: And the perfection of the fear of the Lord \add is\add* wisdom.
He that is not wise will not be taught: But there is a wisdom which multiplieth bitterness.
The knowledge of a wise \add man\add* shall abound like a flood: And his counsel \add is\add* like a pure fountain of life.
The inner parts of a fool \add are\add* like a broken vessel, And he will hold no knowledge as long as he liveth.
If a skilful man hear a wise word, He will commend it, and add unto it: \add But\add* as soon as one of no understanding heareth \add it\add*, it displeaseth him, And he casteth it behind his back.
The talking of a fool \add is\add* like a burden in the way: But grace shall be found in the lips of the wise.
They inquire at the mouth of the wise \add man\add* in the congregation, And they shall ponder his words in \add their\add* heart.
As \add is\add* a house that is destroyed, so \add is\add* wisdom to a fool: And the knowledge of the unwise \add is as\add* talk without sense.
Doctrine unto fools \add is as\add* fetters on the feet, And like manacles on the right hand.
A fool lifteth up his voice with laughter; But a wise \add man\add* doth scarce smile a little.
Learning \add is\add* unto a wise \add man as\add* an ornament of gold, And like a bracelet upon his right arm.
A foolish man’s foot \add is\add* soon in \add his neighbour’s\add* house: But a man of experience is ashamed of him.
A fool will peep in at the door into the house: But he that is well nurtured will stand without.
\add It is\add* the rudeness of a man to hearken at the door: But a wise \add man\add* will be grieved with disgrace.
The lips of talkers will be telling such \add things\add* as pertain not unto them: But the words of such as have understanding are weighed in the balance.
The heart of fools \add is\add* in their mouth: But the mouth of the wise \add is\add* in their heart.
When the ungodly curseth Satan, He curseth his own soul.
A whisperer defileth his own soul, And is hated wheresoever he dwelleth.
